Class GenericServer

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.Network.Server.GenericServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
UpdateListener, Serializable, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
RMIServer, SocketServer

  • Field Details

    • games

      protected static final Map<UUID,Game> games
      A thread-safe collection that maps unique game identifiers (UUID) to their respective Game instances. This map is used to store and manage all active games on the server.

    • controllers

      protected static final Map<UUID, GameController> controllers
      A thread-safe map that stores the association between unique game identifiers (UUID) and their corresponding GameController instances. This map is utilized to manage and retrieve controllers for active games on the server.

    • n

      protected int n
      A protected integer field used to identify the server instance. This variable can be utilized to manage and differentiate between different instances of the server within the application.

    • connectedUsernames

      public static final Set<String> connectedUsernames
      A thread-safe set containing the usernames of currently connected users. This set is used to track and manage active connections. It provides a shared data structure for monitoring connected clients across different parts of the server implementation.

  • Constructor Details

    • GenericServer

      protected GenericServer() throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new GenericServer instance. This constructor initializes the server by invoking the parent class constructor from UnicastRemoteObject.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if an error occurs during the initialization of the server

  • Method Details

    • getConnectedUsernames

      public Set<String> getConnectedUsernames()
      Retrieves the set of usernames currently connected to the server.
      Returns:
      A set of strings representing the usernames of connected users.

    • game

      protected Game game(UUID id)
      Retrieves the Game instance associated with the specified unique identifier (UUID).
      Parameters:
      id - the UUID of the game to retrieve
      Returns:
      the Game object associated with the specified UUID, or null if no game is found

    • start

      public void start(String[] args) throws IOException
      Starts the server with the specified arguments.
      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments used to configure the server or define specific runtime behavior
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during initialization

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the server operations, releasing any resources associated with it. This method is intended to be implemented by subclasses to handle specific shutdown procedures required for the server. Subclasses should ensure that this method performs a clean shutdown, which may include closing connections, stopping threads, or freeing resources. Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if called on the base class without proper overriding in a subclass.

    • updateCardUseSTATE

      public abstract void updateCardUseSTATE(ArrayList<Player> ps, c_State state, UUID matchId) throws Exception
      Updates the current state of card usage in the game for the specified players and match.
      Specified by:
      updateCardUseSTATE in interface UpdateListener
      Parameters:
      ps - the list of players involved in the update.
      state - the c_State object representing the new state to be applied.
      matchId - the unique identifier of the match for which the state is being updated.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the state update process.
